quizzes.title: Sports Quiz: Nickname and Baseman
quizzes.description: Test your sports knowledge with this comprehensive quiz! Features 15 questions covering Sports, g., college. Includes 5 easy, 5 medium, and 5 challenging questions. Can you achieve a passing score of 70%?

questions.question: Bob Gibson was a great pitcher for the St. Louis Cardinals. What was his real first name?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Pack

questions.question: During the period 1984-1989, how many times did the Edmonton OIlers win the NHL championship?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: 4

questions.question: This is the nickname of the first NBA players to play in over 1610 games.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: The Chief

questions.question: He was the first World Series Most Valuable Player.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Johnny Podres

questions.question: The nickname of this hockey great was The pocket rocket.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Henri Richard

questions.question: This sports great was called The Wizard of Dribble and The Magician.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Stan Matthews

questions.question: After the Washington Redskins drafted Ernie Davis, Art Modell of the Browns traded this player for him.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Bobby Mitchell

questions.question: What is the last name of the great shortstop whose nickname was Little Louie?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Aparicio

questions.question: Joe Tinker (shortstop), John Evers (second baseman), and Frank Chance (first baseman) were the two from the famous double play combination for the Cubs. Who was the third baseman?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Harry Steinfeldt

questions.question: Georgi Asparuhov, Magdalena Maleeva, Dan Kolov and Tanya Bogomilova are all great athletes from this nation.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Bulgaria

questions.question: Which is the location of the International Table Tennis Hall of Fame?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Switzerland

questions.question: Which was the first U.S. college to win back-to-back NCAA basketball championships?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Oklahoma AM

questions.question: William G. Morgan, Flo Hyman, Dimitar Zlatanov, Bernie Holtzman, and Karch Kiraly are in a Hall of Fame in this city.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Mt. Holyoke, Massachusetts

questions.question: Which sportsmans nickname was The Bayonne Bleeder?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Chuck Wepner

questions.question: Who was the director of first martial arts movie to win an Oscar?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Ang Lee

quizzes.title: Sports Quiz: Number and Sports
quizzes.description: Test your sports knowledge with this comprehensive quiz! Features 15 questions covering Sports, john, ground. Includes 5 easy, 5 medium, and 5 challenging questions. Can you achieve a passing score of 70%?

questions.question: If you ever get drafted by the Detroit Red Wings and you want to wear #19 you are out of luck. # 19 was retired to honor this former Red Wings captain on January 2, 2007.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Steve Yzerman

questions.question: The first number retired by the Montreal Canadiens on November 2, 1932 belonged to Howie Morenz. What number did he wear?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: 7

questions.question: Derek Jeter was selected by the Yankees 6th overall in the 1992 draft. The first pick went to the Houston Astros, but they drafted this player instead.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Phil Nevin

questions.question: This former Harford Whaler and Carolina Hurricane had his number retired on January 28, 2006. Who is he?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Ron Francis

questions.question: In 1986 Mookie Wilson hit the ground ball that trickled through Bill Buckners legs.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: True

questions.question: John Patrick McEnroe was born on February the 16th 1959 in which European country ?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: West Germany

questions.question: Colorado Rockies star left fielder Matt Holiday earned All-American honors in two sports during his senior year of high school. What were these sports?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Baseball and football

questions.question: How old was Jack Quinn when he hit a home run on June 27, 1932?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: 49 years 357 days

questions.question: This Canadian political figure had his #29 retired by the Montreal Canadiens on January 29, 2007.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Ken Dryden

questions.question: How many pitchers threw perfect games in the 20th century?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: 14

questions.question: What was the home run record until 1879?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: 5

questions.question: On what day was baseball commissioner Bud Selig born?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: July 30, 1934

questions.question: Which of the following is a line in Lou Gehrigs famous farewell speach?

options.text: Today I am the luckiest man on Earth.
I consider myself the luckiest man in the whole world.
Today I consider myself the luckiest man on the face of the Earth.
But today I consider myself the luckiest man on the face of the Earth.

questions.explanation: The correct answer is: But today I consider myself the luckiest man on the face of the Earth.

questions.question: What are the first two numbers officially retired by the Toronto Maple Leafs?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: 5  6

questions.question: Who had the longest hitting streak until 1941?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Willie Keeler

quizzes.title: Geography Quiz: John Mcenroe and Wimbledon
quizzes.description: Test your geography knowledge with this comprehensive quiz! Features 15 questions covering Geography, john, singles. Includes 5 easy, 5 medium, and 5 challenging questions. Can you achieve a passing score of 70%?

questions.question: Which of these teams won the UEFA Champions League trophy after trailing 0:3 at half-time during the final match?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Liverpool

questions.question: In 1983 John McEnroe won Wimbledon for the 2nd time. Who was McEnroes opponent on that occasion ?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Chris Lewis

questions.question: What was the highest score in the UEFA Champions League history from 1991/1992 until 2006/2007?

options.text: Ajax Amsterdam - FA Red Boys Differdange 14:0

questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Liverpool - Besiktas 8:0

questions.question: How many teams played in the 2006 edition of the UEFA Champions League?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: 32

questions.question: During his first participation in Wimbledon, McEnroe was defeated in the semi finals by this player.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Jimmy Connors

questions.question: Which year and what grand slam did John McEnroe first claim ?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: 1979, US Open

questions.question: Which club has won most UEFA Champions League competitions between 1991/1992 and 2006/2007?

options.text: AC Milan and Real Madrid, 3 times each

questions.explanation: The correct answer is: AC Milan and Real Madrid, 3 times each

questions.question: All good things must come to an end; which title and what year did John McEnroe win his last grand slam?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: US Open, 1984

questions.question: In what month and year did John McEnroe become the worlds number 1 player according to the association of tennis professionals?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: March 1980

questions.question: Why finishing third in the group stage is important in the UEFA Champions League?

options.text: The third team of each group goes to UEFA Cup.
One of the 8 teams that finished third can play in play-offs.
It guarantees qualification to the following season competition.

questions.explanation: The correct answer is: The third team of each group goes to UEFA Cup.

questions.question: Is it true John McEnroe never won the French Open?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Yes

questions.question: John McEnroe won his first Wimbledon final in 1980 putting an end to Bjorn Borgs record 5 straight Wimbledon crowns.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: False

questions.question: Which of these countries was never represented in the UEFA Champions League from 1991 to 2007?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Ireland

questions.question: In 1978 John McEnroe won both singles rubbers in the Davis Cup final to help the U.S.A cleam the Davis Cup for the 1st time since 1972.  Which country did the U.S.A defeat?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: United Kingdom

questions.question: In what year did a young John McEnroe first qualify and amazingly reach the semi finals at Wimbledon ?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: 1977

quizzes.title: Sports Quiz: Wrestler and Uefa Champions League

questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Kane

questions.explanation: The correct answer is: John Bradshaw Layfield

questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Road Warrior Animal

questions.question: This old time wrestler was a football coach at Madison High School in Madison Heights, MI where he would eventually become a member of the Michigan Coaches Hall of Fame.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: George The Animal Steele

questions.question: What former football player co-starred in the 80s TV series Webster?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Alex Karras

questions.question: If the final match in the UEFA Champions League ends in a tie, how is the winner decided?

options.text: Extra time is played and if the winner is not decided, penalties are held.
Extra time with a golden goal (the first team to score is the winner)

questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Extra time is played and if the winner is not decided, penalties are held.

questions.question: WWE superstar Edge is the former brother-in-law of this wrestler.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Val Venus

questions.question: Which of the following teams did not win the UEFA Champions League in the period 1991/1992-2006/2007?

questions.question: This pro wrestler was a member of The Cherokee County School District but was disqualified from entering the primary for the 2006 term due to the fact that he did not use his legal name.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Rick Steiner

questions.question: This wrestler played minor youth hockey with and against an NHL tough guy.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Edge

questions.question: What is the maximum number of teams from one country that can participate in the UEFA Champions League?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: 5

questions.question: This former pro wrestler made news headlines in 2004 for causing an anthrax scare at Bostons Downtown Crossing MBTA station.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Brutus The Barber Beefcake

questions.question: Prior to becoming a pro wrestler this man played for various professional European basketball teams. When his career ended due to injury he enlisted in the 202nd Military Police Company in Germany and served in a NATO facility for two years.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Kevin Nash

quizzes.title: Geography Quiz: Yogi Berra and Yankees
quizzes.description: Test your geography knowledge with this comprehensive quiz! Features 15 questions covering Geography, yogi, college. Includes 5 easy, 5 medium, and 5 challenging questions. Can you achieve a passing score of 70%?

questions.question: When Yogi Berra first joined the Yankees, they already had a great catcher. Who was he?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Bill Dickey

questions.question: In 1972 the Yankees retired Yogi Berras uniform number. What was the number?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: 8

questions.question: What was the nickname of NFL Hall of Famer Reggie White?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: The Minister of Defense

questions.question: What college did Nick Buoniconti attend?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Notre Dame

questions.question: Which two famous baseball personalities grew up on the same street as Yogi Berra?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Joe Garagiola and Joe Buck

questions.question: Who was the Greenbay Packers first round draft pick in 1961?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Herb Adderly

questions.question: Yogi Berra was the first player to hit a grand slam home run in the World Series.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: False

questions.question: Yogi Berra was the first player to play in fourteen World Series.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: True

questions.question: In 1942 Yogi Berra was not signed by the team he wanted to play for. Which team was his first choice?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: The St. Louis Cardinals

questions.question: When did Mean Joe Greenes Coke commercial first air on TV?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: October 1979

questions.question: Which statement is true about Yogi Berras military service?

options.text: Yogi never served in the military.
Yogi served in the US Navy.
Yogi served in the Us Air Force.
Yogi served in the US Army.

questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Yogi served in the US Navy.

questions.question: Where was Yogi Berra born?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: St. Louis, Missouri

questions.question: How did Lawrence Peter Berra get the nickname Yogi?

options.text: It is short for an affectionate Italian expression.
It was the name of a popular cartoon character.
He looked like a  character in a movie.

questions.explanation: The correct answer is: He looked like a  character in a movie.

questions.question: How many NFL teams did Pete Carroll coach for prior to coaching at USC?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: 5

questions.question: What was the date for the first induction class into the Pro Football Hall of Fame?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: September 7, 1963

quizzes.title: Sports Quiz: Yogi Berra and Event
quizzes.description: Test your sports knowledge with this comprehensive quiz! Features 15 questions covering Sports, athlete, yogi. Includes 5 easy, 5 medium, and 5 challenging questions. Can you achieve a passing score of 70%?

questions.question: Who was the first Olympian to win gold in the same event in four straight Olympics.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Al Oerter

questions.question: Who was the first male athlete to win the decathlon and pentathlon at Olympics Games?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Jim Thorpe

questions.question: The great manager Paul Richards once said that Yogi Berra was the best bad pitch hitter. What was Yogis response?

options.text: They just dont throw it good-I hit it good.
They dont call it good, but its a good pitch.
If its a bad pitch, why did they throw it?
If I can hit it, its a good pitch.

questions.explanation: The correct answer is: If I can hit it, its a good pitch.

questions.question: Who was the first man to win gold medals in three straight Olympic Games?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Ray Ewry

questions.question: When Yogi Berra was the Yankee manager, there was a famous incident on a bus that made headlines. What was involved?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: a harmonica

questions.question: Who was Coroebus?

options.text: The Greek god of sports and the Olympic Games
The man who invented the Olympic Games in 776 b.c.e.
The first winner of an Olympic event in 776 b.c.e.
The man who raced from Marathon to Athens.

questions.explanation: The correct answer is: The first winner of an Olympic event in 776 b.c.e.

questions.question: After Elston Howard took over most of the catching duties with the Yankees, what position did Yogi Berra learn to play?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Leftfield

questions.question: Yogi Berra is famous for his Yogisms. Which of the following is NOT a Yogi quote?

options.text: Its tough making predictions especially about the future.
Ninety percent of this game is half mental.
When you come to a  fork in the road , take it.
Man this is a long game... were two hours into the sixth inning.

questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Man this is a long game... were two hours into the sixth inning.

questions.question: This Olympic great was one of Robert F. Kennedys personal bodyguards.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Rafer Johnson

questions.question: Which organization gave Yogi Berra the Silver Buffalo Award?

options.text: The Daughters of  the American Revolution

questions.explanation: The correct answer is: The Boy Scouts of America

questions.question: In 1972 Yogi Berra became manager of  this team.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: The New York Mets

questions.question: In the 1956 World Series  against the Brooklyn Dodgers, Yogi Berra caught a very special game. What is untrue about the game?

options.text: Yogi hit a grand slam in the second  inning.
Sal Maglie pitched for the Dodgers.
Don Larson pitched for the Yankees.
There is a famous photo of Yogi jumping into the arms of the Yankee pitcher.

questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Yogi hit a grand slam in the second  inning.

questions.question: Who won the first event in the first modern Olympics in 1896?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: James  B. Connolly

questions.question: Who was Eddie Eagan?

options.text: The first President of the International Olympic Committee
The first person to win gold in the Winter Olympic Games and in the Summer Olympic Games
Eddie The Eagle was a British skier who won a silver medal at the 1984 Olympic Games.
The first American to win an Olympic medal

questions.explanation: The correct answer is: The first person to win gold in the Winter Olympic Games and in the Summer Olympic Games

questions.question: Both of Yogi Berras sons played Major League baseball.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: False
